revised_title: An Unusual Bone Found in a Man's Pelvis
tldr: A doctor, Terence Brady, discovered a unique bone in the pelvis of a man in Brussels. The bone was connected to the mesenterium by a cone-shaped, membranous substance. This case study highlights an unusual ossification event and provides insight into the man's medical history. The bone's presence surprised onlookers and is considered a rare and extraordinary production.
